input_text:
Job Title: Production Supervisor

Location: Morganfield, KY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Manufacturing, Supply Chain

Description:
Vibracoustic is part of the Freudenberg Group. The company ensures a smooth and quiet ride experience in every vehicle. We are driven by our purpose of adding comfort to mobility and providing the perfect solution for the NVH challenges of our automotive customers. As a leading supplier, Vibracoustic is the right place for open-minded, ambitious team-players with a hands-on mentality. Our innovative, safe and dynamic working atmosphere offers many opportunities for your personal growth and development in a global network. Want to join the team?

 Morganfield, KY

On-Site

 Vibracoustic USA Inc.

You support our team as

 Production Supervisor 

Responsibilities 

Schedule operator assignments each day in accordance with shipping schedules.Ensure that operators are trained and have all the raw materials, tools, and equipment necessary to produce quality parts.Examine parts produced to determine if items meet specifications.Interprets company policies to workers and enforces safety regulations.Interprets customer specifications to ensure product produced meets those specifications.May be required to complete or verify paperwork and/or data related to the performance of production employees, employee time worked, scrap, quality, or other assigned reports.Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organizationâ€™s policies and applicable laws. May include appraising and rewarding performances, addressing poor performance or complaints, and resolving problems.Must communicate to management formally or informally concerns related to production and the associated employees.Performs all job duties in accordance with ISO/IATF 16949 and ISO 14001 standards.Complies with all environmental and legal regulations.

Qualifications 

High school diploma or GED required. Associates degree or higher preferred.A minimum of one year of manufacturing leadership experience.Excel, Word, and PowerPoint experience preferred.Ability to interpret customer requirements from written instructions.Good attendance.Good communication skills.Ability to work in a team setting and supervisor others.Ability to drive a fork truck in a safe manner.Good problem solving skills with the ability to follow written and verbal direction.

Some of your Benefits 

Health Insurance: Rely on comprehensive services whenever you need it.

401K Match: Save for retirement with the company's help.

Vacation: We offer time off to refresh and recharge.

Paid Holidays: With paid-time off, local holidays are all the way more relaxing.

Safe Environment: We strive to ensure safety remains a top priority, and provide a stable environment for our employees.

Click here to go directly to our career page. Drive your career!

The Freudenberg Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion. Employment opportunities are available to all applicants and associates without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, mental or physical disability, genetic information, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Production Supervisor
output_json.summary: Supports the team as a Production Supervisor at Vibracoustic USA Inc.
job_responsibilities: Ensures training and resources for operators
Interprets company policies and safety regulations
Performs job duties according to ISO/IATF 16949 and ISO 14001 standards
Complies with environmental and legal regulations
output_json.company_information: Vibracoustic is part of the Freudenberg Group, a leading supplier ensuring a smooth and quiet ride experience in every vehicle.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: The Freudenberg Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion.
